meta.content: Promise Academy in Cleveland is a High School that helps you earn your high school diploma fast. Promise offers credit recovery, college credit, and blended learning programs. Enroll today!

span.span: ue to the Coronavirus, Promise Academy will be closed through April 30th.

Promise Academy teachers and staff will be available throughout the closure on school days from
9:00 am- 3:00 pm for questions and concerns.

Please click on the following link for a list of contact
information:

Zoom rooms will be open on school days from 10am- 11am and 1pm-2pm. This is a great way to virtually connect with your teachers and get the support you need for your academic success. Please sign in with your real name so your teacher can admit you into the room.

span.span: We ask that you visit the website frequently for updates.
If you are in need of meals, the Cleveland Public Library will have meals Monday- Friday 3:30 - 4:30 pm.

Accelerate Your Future with Promise Academy

div.p: Earning a high school diploma with Promise Academy is just the start. Promise Academy combines credit recovery, online learning, and teacher directed instruction to help you finish your diploma fast. Now with our new post-secondary options our students are prepared to enter college, post-secondary training, or a career that aligns with their personal and professional goals.

p.span: Notice is hereby given that the meeting of the Board of Directors of Promise Academy will hold a special meeting on Wednesday, May 6th at 6:00 p.m. via Zoom. The Zoom connection information will be posted soon.
The purpose of the meeting is to discuss the FY 21 Budget and Staffing Plan as well as the Paycheck Protection Program loan.

Student safety is our number one concern. Promise Academy is taking extra precautions to make sure we maintain a safe and healthy environment for our students and staff. Extra cleaning efforts will be initiated to limit germ exposure. We ask that if you are feeling ill to please stay home. Remember to call the school to let us know you are sick and will not be coming in. Please click here for more information about the Corona Virus and what precautions should be taken to stay safe.
Please make sure that the school has your most up to date emergency phone number for communication purposes.

span.span: Make a difference today and for generations to come.

div.p: Promise Academy is committed to providing a website that is accessible to the widest possible audience, regardless of circumstance and ability. We aim to adhere as closely as possible to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0, Level AA), published by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). These guidelines explain how to make Web content more accessible for people with disabilities. Conformance with these guidelines will help make the web more user friendly to everyone. Whilst Promise Academy strives to adhere to the guidelines and standards for accessibility, it is not always possible to do so in all areas of the website and we are currently working to achieve this. Be aware that due to the dynamic nature of the website, minor issues may occasionally occur as it is updated regularly. We are continually seeking out solutions that will bring all areas of the site up to the same level of overall web accessibility. If you have any comments and or suggestions relating to improving the accessibility of our site, please don't hesitate to contact the office at 216-443-0500. Your feedback will help us make improvements.
